hero.title: Regional Research Centers
hero.headline: Advancing Aquatic Science Across Sri Lanka
hero.description: NARA's regional research centers extend our scientific excellence to key coastal and inland areas, conducting localized research, providing training, and supporting sustainable aquatic resource development in communities across the island.

kadolkele.name: Regional Research Center – Kadolkele
kadolkele.description: Located adjacent to Negombo Lagoon in a 14-hectare mangrove area, the Kadolkele center is the largest remaining mangrove patch in the northern part of the lagoon, serving as a vital hub for mangrove research, conservation, and coastal aquaculture development.
mainObjectives: Decentralization of research programs and field-oriented studies
Development of national mangrove research and educational center
Conservation of 14 ha mangrove area for lagoon productivity enhancement
broadObjectives: Rational utilization of coastal resources for finfish and shrimp production
Maximization of employment and income distribution for coastal communities
specificActivities: Mangrove ecosystem management and park development
Resource potential studies of culturable species in brackish water
Breeding success determination of important species
Socioeconomic studies for small-scale aquaculture farmers
Water quality and pollution prevention management
On-site training for schools, universities, farmers on wetland ecosystems

projects.title: An Evaluation of Traditional Fishing Activities in Negombo Estuary, Bolgoda Lake, Madu Ganga and Jaffna lagoon and Strategies for Proper Management

kalpitiya.name: Regional Research Center – Kalpitiya
kalpitiya.description: Established in 1983 at the former 'Ceynor' building, this strategic field station covers the Puttalam Lagoon, Dutch Bay, and Portugal Bay, bordering Wilpattu, with two important rivers (Kala Oya and Appu Aru) providing unique opportunities for marine, brackish water, and freshwater research.
mainObjectives: Decentralization of research programs with field-oriented facilities
Development of coastal aquaculture and related activities
Facilitation of new spheres of aquatic research programs
Support for marine, brackish water, and freshwater research studies

services.title: Mangrove Plants Sales
services.description: Selling mangrove plants at Rs. 40.00 per plant

services.title: Educational Programs
services.description: Conducting awareness programs for school children and university students about mangroves

services.title: Circuit Bungalow Booking
services.description: Accommodation facility available for researchers and visitors

projects.title: Present status of trammel net shrimp fishery in Kalpitiya coastal waters with some biological and socioeconomic aspects
Preliminary study on establishment of Green mussel (Perna viridis) culture in Negombo lagoon, Sri Lanka

kapparathota.name: Regional Research Center – Kapparathota
kapparathota.tagline: Deep Sea Fisheries & Marine Mammal Research
kapparathota.location: Weligama Bay, Matara District, Southern Province
kapparathota.description: Strategically located at Weligama Bay, this center serves as the field station for the south coast, focusing on offshore and deep sea fisheries. The area is renowned for significant marine mammal populations including whales and dolphins, with the international shipping route passing immediately offshore.
specialFeatures: Offshore and deep sea fisheries operations
Small scale and mechanized fishing operations
Significant marine mammal habitat (whales and dolphins)
mainObjectives: Survey and monitoring of marine fishery resources
Continuous monitoring of marine fish catches at coastal landing centers
Collaboration with local fishermen to identify new fishing grounds
Support for inland and coastal aquaculture development
Ornamental fish breeding support and advisory services

projects.title: Studying the suitability of deterrent pingers against depredation of hooked yellowfin tuna and assessment of marine mammal abundance

panapitiya.name: Regional Research Center – Panapitiya
panapitiya.tagline: Center for Living Aquatic Resources Research & Development
panapitiya.location: Horana-Kalutara Road, Kalutara District, Western Province
panapitiya.description: Adjacent to a flood controlling dam, this facility was revitalized by NARA in 2012 to become a premier service hub for ornamental fish farmers. Specializing in KOI carp breeding and ornamental aquaculture, it serves farmers across the district and island-wide.
objectives: Identifying and resolving provincial aquaculture issues for farmers
Developing ornamental aquaculture practices as income generation
Conducting selective breeding programs for KOI
Issuing ornamental fish and brooders to farmers
Introducing cost-effective and scientifically tested ornamental fish feed
currentActivities: Rearing and breeding of KOI Carp, Angel Fish, and Tin Foil Barb
Issuing brood KOI fish and ornamental fish to farmers
Developing stage-specific economical and floating fish feed
Value-adding research on invasive Knife Fish (Mannaya)
Water sample checking and fish disease diagnosis

projects.title: Development of export oriented ornamental fish farming and aquafeed in Kalutara District

rekawa.name: Regional Research Center – Rekawa
rekawa.description: Established in 1999 adjacent to Rekawa Lagoon, this center operates in an area of rich biodiversity with diverse flora and fauna including extensive mangrove systems. It focuses on environmental management, ornamental fish breeding, and community livelihood development.
objectives: Developing ornamental aquaculture for income generation and livelihood
Conducting selective breeding programs for KOI carps
Issuing ornamental fish brooders to farmers
Conducting research on Environmental Management, Fisheries, and Aquaculture
currentActivities: Awareness programs on sensitive marine ecosystems (mangroves, corals, sea grass, sand dunes)
Monitoring and assessment of lagoon and pelagic fishery
Pollution status assessment of selected fisheries harbours
Assessment of fisheries and aquaculture potential in floodplain ecosystems
Rearing KOI carp, Angel fish, Fighters, Rosy barb, Sword tails, and Malawi fish
Addressing environmental matters within the area

services.title: Ornamental Fish Management

services.title: Coastal Ecosystem Management
services.description: Programs on management and restoration of coastal ecosystems

projects.title: Development of livelihoods of fisher communities through introduction of proper aquaculture technologies, environmental monitoring and introduction of nature based ecotourism in Rekawa lagoon, Southern Sri Lanka
